headline: Israel and the US attack Iran: What happened in the first hours of bombing
description: Several sites in Tehran, Isfahan and Tabriz were struck on Saturday morning. Israel has declared a 'special state of emergency.' The Israeli army also targeted positions held by Hezbollah, the pro-Iran Shiite movement in southern Lebanon.

headline: Prosecution requests questionably harsh sentences at murdered teacher Samuel Paty's appeals trial
Mélenchon's attempt to embody an 'antifascist arc' backs the rest of the left into a corner
Epstein case: Bill Clinton scrutinized over past relationship with sexual predator
description: Democrats hope that former President Bill Clinton's testimony on Friday sets a precedent that could pave the way for Donald Trump to appear before the congressional committee.

headline: Paramount acquires Warner Bros. in $110 billion deal, creating Hollywood behemoth
description: The final deal caps a five-month bidding battle with Netflix, and will give birth to one of the most powerful entertainment conglomerates in the world.

headline: Bruno Mars stays as 'feel good' as ever with his new album, 'The Romantic'
description: The American multi-instrumentalist and singer has released his fourth solo album 10 years after the success of '24K Magic.'

headline: Behind Trump and Anthropic standoff lies multifaceted debates over military's use of AI
description: The US president ordered his administration to 'immediately cease' using the start-up's artificial intelligence model after the company refused to make it freely available to the military. The decision has sparked intense debate.

How Paris is turning into 'Frollywood,' a refuge for American actors
description: Whether George Clooney, Matt Dillon or Kristen Stewart, France is attracting more and more actors from across the Atlantic. This trend speaks to both the Trump-era crisis and the decline of the Hollywood model.

headline: Ukraine: 'The war could still last for years and paradoxically, time is not on the Kremlin's side'
description: Researcher Dimitri Minic tells Le Monde in an interview that it is 'too soon to write off Ukraine,' even though the balance of power currently favors Russia.

headline: Five Paris restaurants serving mouthwatering ramen
description: A staple of Japanese cuisine, this noodle soup takes on subtle flavors depending on whether it is made with pork, fish or vegetables. Here are our picks for the best places to enjoy excellent ramen in the French capital.

headline: Mélenchon's deadly race to the bottom
